intro: Truellum debile, commonly known as the slender false mallow, is a small herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is characterized by its delicate, hairy leaves and small, pale pink to white flowers. Truellum debile is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
